Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: the beginning consists of an episodic account of evil and chaos during famine (and the introduction of Miya-san’s Childhood Chicago family), and the second half is a more philosophical account of discord juxtaposed against Miya-san and the kindness that he posits will eventually save us.
